- Topic: Amendment to Permit Expansion of Langston Hughes Academy
- Summary: The ordinance aims to grant an amendment to permit the expansion of Langston Hughes Academy to include an adjacent lot. This expansion involves the development of a new structure in an HU-RS Historic Urban Single-Family Residential District. The ordinance was adopted.

- Summary: The motion ratifies and approves the appointment of John Milazzo, Jr. as a member of the Finance Authority of New Orleans, replacing Charles Brown. The appointment is effective until November 3, 2025, and was adopted.

- Topic: Amendment to Sections 114-126, 114-135, and 114-204 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to lower the retirement system funded ratio threshold required to permit the retirement board of trustees to provide cost-of-living increases or bonuses for retired members and to increase the employer contribution to the retirement system. The Governmental Affairs Committee recommended approval.
- Ordinance Number: 33913-29248 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Healthy Homes Program Ordinance
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to establish a healthy homes program in the City of New Orleans, requiring the registration of rental housing property, and inspections, enforcement, fees, penalties, and adjudications relative thereto. It was introduced by Councilmember Morrell.
- Ordinance Number: 33898
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT, 1 RECUSED)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was amended and passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Healthy Homes Program, Rental Housing, Inspections, Enforcement, Fees, Penalties

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Renter Anti-Displacement Fund Establishment
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish the Renter Anti-Displacement Fund as Division 48 of Article II in Section 70 of the Code of the City of New Orleans, with the purpose of providing protections for renters against displacement. The ordinance was adopted with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,901
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted to establish the Renter Anti-Displacement Fund.

- Topic: Proposal for New Full-Time Staff Positions for Healthy Homes Ordinance
- Summary: The motion directs the Office of Code Enforcement and the Department of Safety and Permits to work on creating new full-time staff employee positions under the Office of Business and External Services to administer and perform inspections pursuant to the Healthy Homes ordinance. The motion was passed.
- Ordinance Number: MOTION — NO. M-22-486
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed, directing the creation of new full-time staff positions for the Healthy Homes ordinance.
- Tags/Keywords: Healthy Homes ordinance, New staff positions, Code enforcement
- UID: 46d2c734-7581-41e6-835c-b87ac3e484fe

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Motion No. M-22-486
- Summary: Motion to direct the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider amendments to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance regarding short-term rentals, in compliance with the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit's ruling and to safeguard the City’s health, safety, and welfare.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-486
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 3: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Motion was passed to direct the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing for amendments to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance regarding short-term rentals.
- Tags/Keywords: City Planning Commission, Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance, short-term rentals, public hearing
- UID: 9b42e38e-d49f-406f-b247-50d928104945

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 11-3-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Section 90-121 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain Section 90-121 of the City Code, specifically related to the payment of police officers through the Office of Police Secondary Employment for secondary employment opportunities or private detail work. It also includes amendments to officer pay schedules for time-based jobs, administrative fee schedule, and the inclusion of Juneteenth Holiday as a specified holiday.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,907
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed after two successful votes, with no amendments or discussions noted.
- Tags/Keywords: City Code, Police Officer Payment, Juneteenth Holiday, Amendment
- UID: 748e3e6f-2cdc-4967-84de-3162212302ed
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 11-3-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Establishment of "Article XIV. — Shopping Carts" within Chapter 146 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish provisions governing the use, control, and abandonment of shopping carts within the City of New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,908
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with 5 council members voting in favor and 2 absent.

- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment was proposed but no voting outcomes were provided.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Sewerage and Water Board Billing Dispute and Appeals Procedures
- Summary: An ordinance to establish billing dispute and appeals procedures for the Sewerage and Water Board of New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,937
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: City-Funded Worker’s Compensation Coverage for Reserve Police Officers
- Summary: An ordinance to mandate that reserve police officers injured in the line of duty receive City-funded worker’s compensation coverage.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,938
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Reserve Police Officers, Worker’s Compensation, Injured Officers
- UID: 607bb911-02cd-437b-bc19-7a58996ef0c5

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment and reordainment of the "Mow to Own" Program
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain the "Mow to Own" Program for the sale of tax adjudicated properties to adjoining property owners who have maintained such properties for at least one year. The ordinance provides policies and procedures for said program.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,946
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with 6 yeas and 0 nays.
- Tags/Keywords: Property sale, Tax adjudicated properties, Policies and procedures
- UID: 68f8b330-925f-463a-bfdf-4bba91f5054c

- Topic: Approval and execution of City of New Orleans contracts
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to ordain Section 70-10 of the Code of the City of New Orleans relative to the approval and execution of City of New Orleans contracts valued at more than one million dollars ($1,000,000) or having a term of more than one (1) year by the City Council.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,947
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 11/17/22
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to a future meeting on 11/17/22 for further discussion and decision.
- Tags/Keywords: City contracts, Approval and execution, Council decision
- UID: 68f8b330-925f-463a-bfdf-4bba91f5054c

- Topic: Unavailable
- Summary: No summary available as the ordinance was continued to a future meeting.

messages.page_content:
Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with Odyssey House Louisiana, Inc.
Summary: The ordinance seeks to authorize the Mayor to enter into an amendment to a previously-executed Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with Odyssey House Louisiana, Inc. for referrals for rehabilitative services and transitional housing. The term of the agreement is proposed to be extended for four years.
Ordinance Number: 33948
Votes Summary:
- Vote 1: N/A
Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.
UID: 5a16a277-a398-4a6c-ba7f-d86d008bca70

Topic: Amendment of Short-Term Rental Standards
Summary: This ordinance aims to amend sections of the city code related to standards for short-term rentals, specifically to remove the residential short-term rental permit type.
Ordinance Number: 33949
Votes Summary:
- Vote 1: N/A
Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.
UID: 5a16a277-a398-4a6c-ba7f-d86d008bca70

Topic: Subpoena and Investigatory Responsibilities of the Orleans Independent Police Monitor
Summary: This ordinance seeks to ordain a section of the city code to provide for subpoena and investigatory responsibilities of the Orleans Independent Police Monitor.
Ordinance Number: 33950
Votes Summary:
- Vote 1: N/A
Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.
UID: 5a16a277-a398-4a6c-ba7f-d86d008bca70

- Topic: Rescinding Short-Term Rental Permits
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to rescind all short-term rental permits issued under City Code 26-613, et seq. It was electronically submitted and subsequently withdrawn.
- Ordinance Number: 33951
- Votes Summary:
    Withdrawn
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was withdrawn.

- Summary: This ordinance provided an operating budget of revenues for the City of New Orleans for the year 2023. It was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.

    Continued to the meeting of 11/17/22

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Downtown Development District’s 2023 Plan
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to adopt the Downtown Development District’s 2023 Plan to provide additional capital and special services, facilities, and improvements for the Downtown Development District of the City of New Orleans for the year 2023. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.
- Ordinance Number: 33955
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 11/17/22

- Topic: New Orleans Tourism and Cultural Fund’s “Tourism and Cultural Economy Program”
- Summary: This ordinance sought to adopt the New Orleans Tourism and Cultural Fund’s “Tourism and Cultural Economy Program”, “Proposed Grant Scoring Matrix”, and budget for the year 2023. It aimed to provide services and financial support to the culture-bearers and cultural economy of New Orleans, and enhance tourism in the city. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.
- Ordinance Number: 33957
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 11/17/22
- Tags/Keywords: New Orleans Tourism, Cultural Economy, Grant Scoring Matrix
- UID: aff558fd-ceba-435c-9106-352f1244d697

- Topic: Capital Budget for the year 2023
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to provide a Capital Budget for the year 2023 in accordance with the provisions of the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans. It was continued to the meeting of 11/17/22.

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to the Classified Pay Plan, Sewerage and Water Board
- Summary: The motion approves the amendment to the Classified Pay Plan for the Sewerage and Water Board, specifically for the Chief Audit Executive, to be effective September 4, 2022, in accordance with the Constitution of Louisiana.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-384 LO
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 11/17/22
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was continued to the next meeting for further discussion or action.
- Tags/Keywords: Classified Pay Plan, Sewerage and Water Board, Amendment
- UID: 7fa78ccb-ff01-45cd-980c-bfad0c1e7d6a

- Topic: Affordable Housing Planned Development in Historic Urban District
- Summary: The motion directs the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider an Affordable Housing Planned Development in specific historic urban districts, allowing the adaptive re-use of an existing institutional structure as a multiple-family residence.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-477
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 11/17/22
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was continued to the next meeting for further discussion or action.
- Tags/Keywords: Affordable Housing, Planned Development, City Planning Commission
- UID: 7fa78ccb-ff01-45cd-980c-bfad0c1e7d6a

- Topic: Zoning Change in Historic Urban Multi-Family Residential District
- Summary: The motion directs the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider a zoning change from HU-RM2 Historic Urban Multi-Family Residential District to HU-MU Historic, without further details provided in the summary.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-480
- Votes Summary:

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Waiver of Fees for Big Easy Bicycle Fest Event
- Summary: The ordinance aims to temporarily waive certain fees, permit fees, and requirements for the Big Easy Bicycle Fest event at Lafitte Greenway Plaza. The duration and boundaries of the waiver are specified. The ordinance was introduced and laid over as required by law.
- Ordinance Number: 33,960
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed and the ordinance was introduced and laid over as required by law.
- Tags/Keywords: Event, Fees, Permit, Waiver, Lafitte Greenway Plaza
- UID: 3fe934cc-2107-4179-8d25-7fbe2d3450cc

- Topic: Amendment for Retail Sale of Packaged Alcoholic Beverages
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to grant an amendment to permit the retail sale of packaged alcoholic beverages in a specific commercial district. The ordinance was introduced and laid over as required by law.
- Ordinance Number: 33,961
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was introduced and laid over as required by law.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, Retail Sale, Alcoholic Beverages, Commercial District
- UID: 3fe934cc-2107-4179-8d25-7fbe2d3450cc

- Topic: Conditional Use Permit for a Hotel
- Summary: This ordinance aims to establish a conditional use permit for a hotel in a specific urban core neighborhood mixed-use district. The ordinance was introduced and laid over as required by law.

- Votes Summary:

- UID: 3fe934cc-2107-4179-8d25-7fbe2d3450cc
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 11-3-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Waiver of fees and requirements for event at Sampson Playground
- Summary: The ordinance aims to temporarily waive certain fees, permit fees, and requirements within and around Sampson Playground for the Leonard Price and Stop the Violence Rally 2022 on October 29, 2022. The waiver specifies the duration and boundaries of the event. 
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,963
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Fee waiver, Sampson Playground, Leonard Price and Stop the Violence Rally
- UID: 2dc7f7f1-32c8-44f1-b378-f04f6752592f

- Topic: Amendment to Section 70-415.303 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to amend Section 70-415.303 of the Code of the City of New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,964
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Code amendment, City of New Orleans
- UID: 2dc7f7f1-32c8-44f1-b378-f04f6752592f

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Jail Release Navigator initiative
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with Goodwill Industries of Southeast Louisiana for eighteen months to implement the Jail Release Navigator initiative within the City’s Safety and Justice Challenge Plan.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,965
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Jail Release Navigator initiative, Goodwill Industries
- UID: 2dc7f7f1-32c8-44f1-b378-f04f6752592f
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 11-3-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of 2022 Operating Budget for New Orleans
- Summary: The council considered two ordinances (33965 and 33966) to amend Ordinance No. 28,863 M.C.S., reducing the 2022 General Fund appropriation to the Department of Police and increasing the appropriation to the Department of Sanitation to fund additional Sanitation expenses in 2022. 
- Ordinance Number: 33965, 33966
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinances passed to amend the 2022 operating budget, reallocating funds from the Department of Police to the Department of Sanitation.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget Amendment, Department of Police, Department of Sanitation
- UID: 7ba7d297-0655-4e96-9d12-4c6e4b75fc72

- Topic: Gasoline Surcharge Amendment
- Summary: The council reviewed an ordinance (33967) proposed by Councilmember Thomas to include an additional $1.00 gasoline surcharge for each completed trip until December 31, 2022.
- Ordinance Number: 33967
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 3 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, implementing the $1.00 gasoline surcharge for each completed trip until the end of 2022.
- Tags/Keywords: Gasoline Surcharge, Transportation, City Code Amendment
- UID: 7ba7d297-0655-4e96-9d12-4c6e4b75fc72

- Topic: Motion to Adjourn
- Summary: The council motioned to adjourn the meeting at 4:30 PM.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to adjourn was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Meeting Adjournment, Council Procedure
- UID: 7ba7d297-0655-4e96-9d12-4c6e4b75fc72
